intro: Hieracium tenoreanum, commonly known as the Alpina Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at high elevations, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium tenoreanum is often found in mountainous areas, contributing to the biodiversity of alpine ecosystems.
